name: Flight Passengers
title: Flight Passengers

api_list.name: /records
api_list.description: The 'records' endpoint of the FlightPassengers API is the primary function that allows users to retrieve important information related to flight passengers. This endpoint provides a convenient way to access an array of objects containing specific rows of data that are associated with the query parameters provided.By making use of the 'records' endpoint, users can seamlessly search for and retrieve vital details about flight passengers based on their specific needs or criteria. The returned array of objects holds all the relevant information in an organized manner, allowing users to access and utilize the data efficiently.This endpoint serves as a valuable tool for users who require passenger-related information, such as passenger names, contact details, booking status, and more. It empowers users to effectively analyze and work with the data to meet their unique purposes, whether it be for statistical analysis, record-keeping, customer support, or any other passenger-related task.With the 'records' endpoint of the FlightPassengers API, users can effortlessly access the desired information they need, making it an essential component for seamlessly managing and working with flight passenger data.

api_list.name: /operatingAirlineIataCode
api_list.description: The 'operatingAirlineIataCode' endpoint in the 'FlightPassengers' API provides a user-friendly way to retrieve a list of possible values for the field 'operatingAirlineIataCode'. This code represents the International Air Transport Association (IATA) code of the airline responsible for operating a flight. The 'operatingAirlineIataCode' is a unique two-letter code assigned to each airline, like F9 for Frontier Airlines or DL for Delta Air Lines.By accessing this endpoint, users can obtain an array of strings that contains all the possible 'operatingAirlineIataCode' values. These values can be utilized for various purposes, such as filtering or categorizing flight data. It allows developers or users to easily identify and differentiate airlines involved in flights.This endpoint enhances the usability of the 'FlightPassengers' API by providing a comprehensive and organized list of operating airline codes, allowing users to efficiently access and work with the specific information related to airlines in a user-friendly manner.

api_list.name: /activityPeriod
api_list.description: The 'activityPeriod' endpoint in the FlightPassengers API is a useful resource that provides a range of time periods during which flight passengers have engaged in certain activities. This endpoint returns an array of strings containing multiple values for the 'activityPeriod' field. The 'activityPeriod' field represents specific periods, typically denoted by dates in a specific format (e.g., YYYYMMDD), when passengers have participated in various activities related to flights. These activities could include booking flights, check-ins, boarding, or any other actions within the flight journey. By accessing this endpoint, you can retrieve a comprehensive list of all the possible time periods during which flight passengers have been active. This information can be valuable for analyzing patterns, trends, or even tracking individual passenger activities within the flight operations.

api_list.name: /terminal
api_list.description: The 'terminal' endpoint in the FlightPassengers API provides a set of potential options for the 'terminal' field. This field refers to the designated location within an airport where passengers can board or disembark from flights. The endpoint returns an array of strings, which are different terminal names that can be selected when specifying terminal information for flight passengers.By utilizing this endpoint, developers can access a wide range of terminal options, such as Terminal 1, Terminal 2, or Terminal 3, which are often designated by numerical digits. Additionally, more specific terminal names like Terminal 1 International or Terminal 2 Domestic may be available.This endpoint is designed to provide an easy way to fetch all the possible values for the 'terminal' field, ensuring accurate and up-to-date information can be incorporated into applications or websites that rely on specifying terminal details for flight passengers.

api_list.name: /operatingAirline
api_list.description: The 'operatingAirline' endpoint in the 'FlightPassengers' API provides an array of strings representing different airlines that operate flights. It gives users access to a comprehensive list of airline names that can be encountered while working with the API. This endpoint allows users to obtain all the possible values for the 'operatingAirline' field, enabling them to effectively sort, filter, or analyze flight-related data based on the operating airline. For instance, if a user wants to see flights operated by a specific airline, they can use this endpoint to retrieve the list of airlines available and select the desired one. This information can be helpful for various purposes, such as in-flight passenger surveys, airline performance analysis, or customer preferences research.

api_list.name: /priceCategoryCode
api_list.description: The endpoint 'priceCategoryCode' in the API 'FlightPassengers' provides an array of strings that represents the different categories of prices available for flights. These categories help airlines classify and differentiate fare options for passengers. Each string in the array corresponds to a specific price category code.For instance, airlines may offer different fare categories like 'Economy', 'Business', 'First Class', or 'Premium Economy'. The 'priceCategoryCode' endpoint returns all the possible values for these categories in a user-friendly manner. This allows users, such as travel agencies or travelers themselves, to easily access and understand the available fare options.By utilizing this endpoint, users can efficiently filter flights based on their preferred price category, enabling them to find the most suitable and affordable options. It enhances the overall user experience by providing a comprehensive overview of price categories and facilitating the decision-making process when it comes to flight bookings.

api_list.name: /publishedAirline
api_list.description: The 'publishedAirline' endpoint from the 'FlightPassengers' API provides helpful information about the available airlines. When you access this endpoint, it returns a list of different airline names as an array of strings.This endpoint allows you to retrieve all the possible values for the field 'publishedAirline'. This means you can get a comprehensive list of the airlines that are supported by the API. By using this endpoint, you can discover a wide range of airlines that offer services.For example, you might find well-known airlines like Frontier Airlines, Delta Air Lines, and Alaska Airlines. However, the exact list will vary depending on the API's database and the airlines they provide information on. Each string in the array represents the name of an airline.This endpoint helps users understand the available airlines, gather useful data for analysis, or filter and search specific airlines they are interested in learning more about. It provides an easy and user-friendly way to retrieve this information directly from the API.

api_list.name: /geoSummary
api_list.description: The 'geoSummary' endpoint in the FlightPassengers API provides a user-friendly way to retrieve a range of options related to geographical summaries of flights. When you make a request to this endpoint, it returns an array containing strings that represent different categories or types of flight destinations. These strings indicate the geographical classification of flights, allowing you to understand if the flight is domestic or international, among other possibilities.This endpoint is particularly useful when you need to categorize and analyze flight data based on their geographical location. By retrieving all the possible values for the 'geoSummary' field, you gain insights into the distribution and nature of flights, such as identifying whether they are predominantly domestic or international. These values can be utilized to generate informative reports, enhance understanding of passenger preferences, or assist in making data-driven decisions in the aviation industry.With the 'geoSummary' endpoint, you can efficiently access a comprehensive list of geographical summaries related to flights, facilitating efficient analysis and interpretation of flight data.

api_list.name: /publishedAirlineIataCode
api_list.description: The endpoint 'publishedAirlineIataCode' from the API 'FlightPassengers' provides a user-friendly way to access an array of strings. These strings represent the possible values for the 'publishedAirlineIataCode' field. The 'publishedAirlineIataCode' field is used to identify the International Air Transport Association (IATA) code associated with an airline. By calling this endpoint, you can obtain a comprehensive list of available IATA codes for airlines. These codes are used universally in the aviation industry to uniquely identify airlines. They consist of two characters that serve as a convenient shorthand for referring to different airlines.For instance, if you are building an application that requires users to select their preferred airline, you can utilize this endpoint to fetch the complete list of IATA codes. This enables your users to make accurate selections from the available options, ensuring precision in airline identification.Note that the above-mentioned example values (F9, DL, AS) are not part of the description of the endpoint, but they serve as illustrations of the type of strings you can expect to receive from the 'publishedAirlineIataCode' endpoint.

api_list.name: /boardingArea
api_list.description: The 'boardingArea' endpoint of the 'FlightPassengers' API provides valuable information about the various boarding areas within an airport. It offers an array of strings representing all the possible values for the 'boardingArea' field. Boarding areas are designated sections within an airport terminal where passengers wait for their flights, undergo security checks, and board their airplanes. These areas are typically identified by alphabetical or numerical codes. The 'boardingArea' endpoint allows you to retrieve a comprehensive list of these codes.By utilizing this endpoint, you can obtain essential data about the available boarding areas at an airport. This information can be valuable for various purposes, such as facilitating the organization and management of passenger flows, ensuring smooth transitions between flights, and providing clear directions to passengers regarding their specific boarding areas.The 'boardingArea' endpoint provides a user-friendly and concise way to access all the potential values for the 'boardingArea' field, allowing you to enhance the passenger experience and optimize airport operations.

api_list.name: /geoRegion
api_list.description: ThegeoRegion' endpoint from the FlightPassengers API provides valuable information about different geographical regions. It returns an array of strings that contain possible values for the 'geoRegion' field. This field represents the specific location or region associated with a flight passenger's journey.For example, if someone travels within the United States, the 'geoRegion' value for that passenger would be 'US'. Similarly, if another passenger's journey involves multiple countries such as the United States and Mexico, the 'geoRegion' value would be 'US, Mexico'.By using this endpoint, you can access a comprehensive list of potential 'geoRegion' values. This information can be immensely useful for analyzing flight passenger data from various regions, identifying popular travel destinations or routes, and gaining insights into travel patterns.

api_list.name: /dataListIndex
api_list.description: The 'dataListIndex' endpoint in the FlightPassengers API provides a user-friendly way to access a range of options related to passenger data. When you call this endpoint, it returns an array of strings containing various 'dataListIndex' values. These values represent potential indexes or identifiers related to passenger information within the API.For instance, if you were to make a request to this endpoint, you might receive a response like ['AB33', 'KLJ24', 'RT89']. Each string in the array represents a unique code, which could correspond to different types of passenger data such as flight records, booking references, or passenger identification numbers.By accessing this endpoint, developers or users can dynamically gather all the possible 'dataListIndex' values available within the FlightPassengers API. This information can then be utilized to retrieve specific passenger records or access related data associated with each 'dataListIndex' entry.Overall, the 'dataListIndex' endpoint serves as a convenient tool within the FlightPassengers API to explore and manipulate passenger-related data efficiently.

api_list.name: /activityTypeCode
api_list.description: The 'activityTypeCode' endpoint in the 'FlightPassengers' API provides a user-friendly way to access a list of possible values for the 'activityTypeCode' field. The 'activityTypeCode' field represents the different actions related to passengers' activities during their flight journey. This endpoint returns an array of strings that represents these possible values. By using this endpoint, developers can retrieve information about the various activities that passengers can undertake, such as boarding, disembarking, security checks, and more. These values help in categorizing and tracking passenger movements and actions throughout their travel experience. With the 'activityTypeCode' endpoint, developers can easily access a comprehensive list of all the different activity types supported by the API, allowing them to integrate this information into their applications or systems. This helps enhance user experience by providing accurate and detailed insights into passenger activities during flights.

api_list.name: /passengerCount
api_list.description: The 'passengerCount' endpoint from the 'FlightPassengers' API provides a user-friendly way to retrieve all the possible values for the field 'passengerCount'. This endpoint is designed to return an array of strings, which are numerical values representing the number of passengers on a flight. These values indicate the varying passenger capacities of different flights.By accessing this endpoint, you can obtain a comprehensive list of potential passenger counts, allowing you to understand the distribution and range of passengers on flights. This information can be helpful for various purposes, such as analyzing travel trends, optimizing airline operations, or conducting research on passenger demographics.The array of strings returned by this endpoint will consist of unique numerical values, each representing a specific passenger count. These values can range from smaller numbers like 1, 2, or 10, to larger numbers like 100, 1000, or 10000, depending on the capacity of the flights within the dataset.By utilizing the 'passengerCount' endpoint, you can easily retrieve an inclusive list of all the possible passenger counts, enabling you to gain insights into the diverse passenger capacities present in the aviation industry.
